Ratings.comment: I do not recommend taking a class with her at all. All she does is talk on and on. She gives us last minute homework assignments and brings up random topics she's never covered in class before. She's a little rude too telling the class that ALMOST everyone speaks good Spanish. That is so rude to say to a class of students learning a new language.
No ones knows more Brazilian art history than her!

The absolute worst Spanish teacher I have ever had. Genuinely does not know how to communicate. It is never clear what she wants from the students and no one ever knew what to do for homework. Genuinely lost my ability to speak Spanish over the course of a semester with her. If you get her as a teacher, do yourself a favor, and get out.

I have had her for two semesters and have constantly been disappointed. She is a wonderfully nice lady but horrible instructor, and I emphasize horrible. She doesn't follow the syllabus, changes grade requirements constantly and emails hw assignments that take hours at 9pm the day before a 9:30am class. Would never take a class with her again.
Really fun teacher. Very helpful. She helped me outside of the classroom, which many teachers do not. It's obvious she cares about the subject and her students.

Never posted grades.  Inconsistent on how she graded. Grades were random with no constructive criticism.  Definitely played favorites with her students.  I took three OSU Spanish classes before I took her class.  I had all As.  She gave me a D. I grieved the grade through the Student Advocacy Center, and eventually earned a C.

This teacher is all over the place. I have no idea what is going on any of the time and her tests are insanely random. She gives 10 MC questions worth 50% of each test grade and 2 short essays for the other 50%.  She assigns questions on a boring book and then she talks about the most random stuff in class. The grading is easy, but she's crazy.

I took three classes with Pedro. While unorganized and he sometimes goes on rants, he is extremely knowledgeable when it comes to content and understanding when it comes to grades. He wants the class to learn the content so he does not focus on grades as much as a similar level language class.

This man is the most unorganized being I have ever met. His grading criteria is flawed. Gives no feedback and pop quizzes are hard. The syllabus changes everyday and changed the night before. He refutes you ideas and thinks hes right. The class consisted on headaches and uncertainty. I would not recommend literally take it with abotone else

His syllabus is a mess. He's not clear about assignments and expectations. The pop quiz was irrelevant. He comes late to class all the time but has a mandatory attendance policy. His grading scale is flawed. Nobody knows what is going on. He always shoots down people's answers which makes people not want to participate. Would not recommend him!

Professor Pereira is extremely vague in his instruction and is not open to feedback. He is always changing the syllabus in regard to when work is due, and will inform the class of changes the night before an analysis is due. I would absolutely not recommend this professor due to his ambiguity regarding class and his expectations in general.

Professor is not clear about his expectations for the class and for the students. Also the professor doesn't give the students the opportunity to make questions or elaborate on topics relevant for the class.
Interesting and personable professor. I looked forward to going. I highly recommend his class.
